docs.title: Welcome to My Documentation
docs.text: This is the home page of your documentation site with version support using Mike.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 📚 Multi-version Documentation: Support for multiple versions using Mike
  • 🎨 Material Theme: Beautiful and responsive Material Design theme
  • 🔍 Search: Full-text search functionality
  • 🌙 Dark Mode: Toggle between light and dark themes
  • 📱 Mobile Friendly: Responsive design for all devices

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Get started by exploring the documentation:

  • Getting Started - Learn how to use this documentation
  • API Reference - Detailed API documentation

docs.title: Version Information
docs.text:
This documentation supports multiple versions. You can switch between versions using the version selector.

Current Version

You are currently viewing the latest version of the documentation.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Contributions are welcome! Please see the repository for more information on how to contribute.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This page contains the API reference documentation.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: All API requests require authentication using an API key.

docs.title: Headers
docs.text:
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
Content-Type: application/json

docs.title: GET /api/v1/users
docs.text:
Retrieve a list of users.

Parameters:

Parameter Type Description limit integer Maximum number of users to return (default: 20) offset integer Number of users to skip (default: 0) search string Search term to filter users

Response:

{
  "users": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 1,
  "limit": 20,
  "offset": 0
}

docs.title: POST /api/v1/users
docs.text:
Create a new user.

Request Body:

{
  "name": "Jane Doe",
  "email": "jane@example.com",
  "password": "secure_password"
}

Response:

{
  "id": 2,
  "name": "Jane Doe",
  "email": "jane@example.com",
  "created_at": "2023-01-02T00:00:00Z"
}

docs.title: GET /api/v1/users/{id}
docs.text:
Retrieve a specific user by ID.

Parameters:

Parameter Type Description id integer User ID

Response:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john@example.com",
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z"
}

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text: The API uses standard HTTP status codes and returns error information in JSON format.

docs.title: Error Format
docs.text:
{
  "error": {
    "code": "VALIDATION_ERROR",
    "message": "The request data is invalid",
    "details": {
      "field": "email",
      "issue": "Email format is invalid"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Status Codes
docs.text: Status Code Description 200 Success 201 Created 400 Bad Request 401 Unauthorized 403 Forbidden 404 Not Found 500 Internal Server Error

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to the getting started guide for this documentation site.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This documentation is built with MkDocs and uses Mike for version management.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To work with this documentation locally:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/mkdocs-gh-pages.git
cd mkdocs-gh-pages

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Serve locally
mkdocs serve

docs.title: Local Development
docs.text:
# Start development server
mkdocs serve

# Build static site
mkdocs build

docs.title: Version Management with Mike
docs.text:
# Deploy a new version
mike deploy --push --update-aliases 1.0 latest

# List all versions
mike list

# Set default version
mike set-default --push latest

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
mkdocs-gh-pages/
├── docs/
│   ├── index.md
│   ├── getting-started.md
│   └── api.md
├── mkdocs.yml
├── requirements.txt
└── .github/
    └── workflows/
        └── deploy.yml

docs.title: Code Highlighting
docs.text:
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
    return True
